com.i2group.apollo.purgeservice

Interface IPurgeService


  • public interface IPurgeService
    A pair of methods for removing all trace of items and sets in the Analysis Repository.

    Note: Unlike some other services in i2 Analyze, the methods of IPurgeService are not affected by the presence of ProhibitedOperation indicators in the schema.

    Since:
    2.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void purgeItems(String sessionId, List<ItemIdentifier> itemIdentifiers)
      Purges the Items with the specified ItemIdentifiers from the Analysis Repository, making all data non-retrievable. If any of the Items owns a set, the Items in that set are not affected.
      void purgeSet(String sessionId, ItemIdentifier itemIdentifier)
      Purges the Entity with the specified ItemIdentifier and all of the Items in the set that the Entity owns from the Analysis Repository, making all data non-retrievable.

    • Method Detail

      • purgeItems

        void purgeItems(String sessionId,
                List<ItemIdentifier> itemIdentifiers)
         throws ItemNotFoundException,
                ItemSupplantedException
        Purges the Items with the specified ItemIdentifiers from the Analysis Repository, making all data non-retrievable. If any of the Items owns a set, the Items in that set are not affected.

        It is not possible to purge an Item that has acted as the source in a merge operation. Instead, when an Item is purged, any Items that appear in the merge history of that Item are also purged.

        Note: Purging any Entity from the Analysis Repository also purges any Links connected to that Entity.

        Parameters:
        sessionId - A String containing the identifier of the client session making the purge request. This is the same identifier as the one passed to the CommandList constructor.
        itemIdentifiers - The ItemIdentifiers of the Items to purge.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFoundException - If one of the specified Items does not exist, or has already been purged.
        ItemSupplantedException - If one of the specified Items has acted as the source in a merge operation.

      • purgeSet

        void purgeSet(String sessionId,
              ItemIdentifier itemIdentifier)
       throws InvalidArgumentException,
              ItemSupplantedException
        Purges the Entity with the specified ItemIdentifier and all of the Items in the set that the Entity owns from the Analysis Repository, making all data non-retrievable. The operation is subject to the following conditions:
        • If the Entity does not own a set, then nothing is purged.
        • If an Item in the set is the product of a merge operation, then any Items that appear in the merge history of that Item are also purged.
        • If an Item in the set has acted as the source in a merge operation but is not a merge product, then that Item is not also purged.
        Note: If any of the Entitys in the purged set also own sets, the Items in those sets are not purged. Purging any Entity from the Analysis Repository also purges any Links connected to that Entity.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - A String containing the identifier of the client session making the purge request. This is the same identifier as the one passed to the CommandList constructor.
        itemIdentifier - The ItemIdentifier of the Entity to purge.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If the specified ItemIdentifier refers to a Link.
        ItemSupplantedException - If the specified ItemIdentifier refers to an Entity that has acted as the source in a merge operation.
